title: Zelensky Brings Backup to the White House as Trump Aligns More Closely With Putin
summary: European leaders are joining a trip to Washington to make sure the trans-Atlantic alliance remains intact.

title: Trump Officials Hint at Possible Concessions by Putin
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Steve Witkoff, an envoy for President Trump, suggested that a peace deal was still distant.

title: Zelensky Calls for ‘Lasting’ Peace in Ukraine Ahead of Trump Meeting
summary: Ahead of a meeting with President Trump, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine noted that Russia’s 2014 seizure of Ukrainian land became “a springboard for a new attack.”

title: Trump’s Selective Stance on Justice: Redemption for Some, Scorn for Others
summary: President Trump, himself a felon, has shown particular leniency to criminals he seems to identify with — people who are white or wealthy, or who rioted in his name on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Pence Welcomes Trump’s D.C. Deployment of the National Guard
summary: Former Vice President Mike Pence said he wished President Trump “would have done more” on Jan. 6, but supported the recent decision to deploy troops to Washington.

title: For a Few Hours, a Party Drowns Out the Tensions in D.C.
summary: At Fort Dupont Park, thousands gathered to honor a local music legend, creating a brief refuge from the conflict.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Will Crush India’s Exporters, Threatening Livelihoods
summary: New U.S. taxes on American imports, even at 25 percent, will hurt many Indian businesses and may put vast numbers of people out of work.

title: Trump Is Pushing India Back Toward China
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had been moving to align India with the United States and freeze out China. Now, efforts to rebuild ties between the Asian giants are gaining momentum.

title: A Lifelong Party of ‘Puzzle-Making Tomfoolery’
summary: In 1978, Jerry Slocum assembled the first International Puzzle Party in his living room. Now it’s a global event.

title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Say They Will Defy Back-to-Work Order
summary: The decision by the union representing the 10,000 workers means that travel chaos will continue for at least a second day. Air Canada said it had suspended its reopening plan until Monday evening.

title: 3 Killed, 9 Wounded in Gang-Related Shooting at a Brooklyn Bar
summary: Nine others were treated for injuries after the early-morning shooting in the Crown Heights neighborhood, the police said.

title: Terence Stamp, Luminary of 1960s British Cinema, Dies at 87
summary: Known for his “heartbreak blue eyes,” he starred in “Billy Budd” and “The Collector,” and had a memorable role in “Superman” and “Superman II.”

title: $800 for a Credit Card? Why Your Premium Cards Will Cost More.
summary: Credit card companies and airlines are in a race for customers who spend the most money — and that is making it harder for many other customers to score deals and perks.

title: All Russia Needs to Do Is Go Home
summary: The meeting was a stark reminder of a simple truth: That the real barrier between President Trump and peace in Ukraine is Vladimir Putin.

title: Trump’s Plans for A.I. Might Hit a Wall. Thank Europe.
summary: The president wants to unleash American artificial intelligence companies on the world, but Europe can still stand in his way.

title: A Centrist Surges in Bolivia as Voters Turn Away From Socialism
summary: Rodrigo Paz, who had trailed in the polls, won the first round of the presidential election on Sunday, as decades of dominance by a leftist party neared an end.

title: Brighty the Burro, Beloved Grand Canyon Statue, Is Rescued From Dragon Bravo Fire
summary: The statue was missing an ear and two front legs, but it was mostly intact when crews recovered it from the Dragon Bravo fire.

title: Ronnie Rondell, Stuntman Set on Fire for Pink Floyd Cover, Dies at 88
summary: He was also known for his performances in “Twister” and “The Matrix Reloaded,” and came from a family of stunt performers.

title: Israel Says Iranian Agents Recruited Dozens of Its Citizens
summary: The agents cajoled people into acts of sabotage and even assassination plots. The cases have raised questions about greed, gullibility and loyalty.
